definition[0]: to use time, energy, goods etc
example[0]: Only 27% of the paper we consume is recycled.
example[1]: A smaller vehicle will consume less fuel.
example[2]: Alcohol may not be consumed on the premises.
definition[2]: if a feeling or idea consumes you, it affects you very strongly, so that you cannot think about anything else
example[3]: She was scared by the depression which threatened to consume her.
example[4]: He was consumed with guilt after the accident.
definition[3]: if fire consumes something, it destroys it completely
definition[4]: to buy and use goods, services, energy, or natural materials
example[5]: Never underestimate the power of the American citizen to consume.
example[6]: The UK and France consume more gas than Italy, mainly because of their colder climates.
definition[5]: to use money or time that could be used for something else
example[7]: Expenses consume less than 16 cents of every revenue dollar at Wal-Mart.
example[8]: Lawsuits consume time and hurt a companyâ€™s image.
